import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";
import RequestSchema from "@theme/RequestSchema";

import OperationTabs from "@theme/OperationTabs";

import Heading from "@theme/Heading";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Get labels for custom field filter values"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/filters/label/{filterId}/for/custom-field/{customFieldTypeId}/values"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Returns display labels for custom field filter values. This is useful when custom field filters store raw values that need to be translated into user-friendly labels.

**Prerequisites**
1. **filterId** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/filters/for/entitytype/\{entityTypeId\}](/docs/api/filters/list-filters-for-entity-type) and extract `Items[].FilterId`.
2. **customFieldTypeId** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/custom-fields/types](/docs/api/custom-fields/list-custom-field-types) and extract `Items[].CustomFieldTypeId`.

**Workflow Example**
1. Collect the raw filter values stored in a view or filter set.
2. Submit the values array: [POST /api/v1.0/filters/label/\{filterId\}/for/custom-field/\{customFieldTypeId\}/values](/docs/api/filters/get-custom-field-filter-value-labels).
3. Replace raw values with returned labels in the UI.

**Minimal Required Fields**: filterId, customFieldTypeId (path), and a body array of values.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"filterId","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}},{"name":"customFieldTypeId","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={{"content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"string"}}}}}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
